definition: a promise worth one thousand in gold (idiom); a promise that must be kept
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: Jinjiufu keeps its promise of faith and is as sincere as gold to its partners.
sentences.chinese: 金九福對信譽一諾千金，對客戶及合作伙伴赤誠如金。

sentences.english: The ancient has a promise that can be counted on view , this view is very correct.
sentences.chinese: 古人有一諾千金的說法，這說法是很準確的。

sentences.english: Uli lieutenant answered as well as gold.
sentences.chinese: 烏利中尉一諾千金地回答。

sentences.english: Do prior life, the most precious is as good as gold.
sentences.chinese: 做事先做人，最珍貴的莫過一諾千金。

sentences.english: What he promised us is but a lip-service.
sentences.chinese: 他對我們的許諾不過是個一諾千金而已。

sentences.english: As good as gold will allow you to make many friends.
sentences.chinese: 一諾千金會讓你交到很多朋友。
